abstracts.cdata!:
This project, Supporting Access to
            on-site Sanitation Services through OBA, has as its
            principal objective the aim of reducing poverty and
            attaining millennium goals in matters of sanitation and
            potable water. It is hoped that this project will allow more
            areas, including the periurban areas, to have ready access
            to sanitation. While the project is seen as having
            tremendous upside for the community, there are several
            potential negative impacts resulting primarily from the
            construction phase. The laying of the sewer mains may result
            in damage to trees and vegetation, and as a result, there is
            a risk of soil erosion. Noise pollution will be a problem,
            as well as the possibility of accidents occurring during
            excavation. Hygiene and public health are expected to suffer
            during the period of construction. There are risks of
            flooding and overflowing in the excavated areas.
